title: Braun Strowman sends message to Tyson Fury after Hell in a Cell

Braun Strowman has fired a subtle warning to Tyson Fury after the pairs row at Smackdown last week.

The Gypsy King was ringside on Friday night when he became embroiled in an altercation with Strowman.

Fury then had to be restrained by security after hurdling the barricades and attempting to make a beeline for the ring.

The pair are now rumoured to be squaring off in what will be Fury's WWE debut at the establishments Crown Jewel event in Saudi Arabia on October 31.

But they are likely to meet sooner than that, as Fury has confirmed he will appear on Monday Night Raw.

Fury said in a video on Instagram : "Last night we attended WWE Smackdown for my son's 8th birthday. Me, as a lifelong WWE fan, and it is his favourite thing.

"I was insulted in front of my whole family by Braun Strowman. It got a little bit heated and we saw what happened.

"I have been invited to an open mic session at RAW on Monday night. I accept and I will be there.

"If Braun Strowman doesn't behave himself, he will get some of these hands, the big dosser."

But Strowman has responded in a thinly-veiled message to the boxing heavyweight on Twitter , by posting a clip of him punching an opponent, captioned: "A right hook...imagine that. #GetTheseHands"

The WWE star - real name Adam Scherr - was in action on Sunday's pay-per-view event Hell in a Cell.

He teamed up with The Viking Raiders against The O.C. in a six-man tag team match.

The match was ruled in favour of Strowman and co. by disqualification, after The O.C. had dished out an illegal three-on-one attack.

But Strowman had the last laugh, catching AJ Styles with the right hook which he later goaded Fury with on social media.

Elsewhere at the event , Seth Rollins retained the Universal Championship following a brutal attack on Bray Wyatt resulted in their bout behind ruled a no contest.

Chad Gable beat Baron Corbin, while The Kabuki Warriors won the Women's Tag Team Championship.
description: The WWE star goaded Fury on Friday's Smackdown with the pair now looking set to meet in the ring
